key_channel_insights.line_content: Over 90% of OTA fares remain above the airline website's prices, though with only modest markups averaging up to 0.11%.
Price matching on MSE grew from around 50% to nearly 65%, with fewer instances of fares undercutting the airline’s website.
Over 95% of GDS fares are higher than the website, reflecting consistent markups without large fluctuations.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over 90% of fares on the OTA channel are higher than the direct site, but the markup remains modest at around 0.05–0.11%.
Less than 1% of itineraries are cheaper on OTA, appearing sparsely and mainly in non-TW markets.
Website fares were missing on OTA about 5–7% of the time, showing minimal fluctuation over recent weeks.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Unavailable fares hovered around 5–10% across dimensions, with minor week-over-week shifts.
No consistent instances of identical pricing were observed.
Rarely seen in the data, averaging under 1% of cases.
Dominant status at over 90%, though price differences remained under 0.11%.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Mirrors overall trends: OTA fares are higher about 93% of the time, with a 0.05–0.09% premium.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA fares reached 96% higher frequency at up to 0.11% over, and no lower-priced listings occurred.
Frequency of OTA higher ranged from 89% to 92%, at a 0.06% premium, with a scant 0.65% lower presence last week.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: About 93% of itineraries priced higher on OTA by up to 0.09%, with missing fares near 6%.
OTA higher hovered at 94–96%, at a 0.04–0.08% premium, and no lower-priced instances were noted.

mse_highlights.line_content: Parity between the channel and the website rose sharply from around 50% last month to nearly 65% this week.
Instances of the MSE channel undercutting the website dropped by 15% compared to last month.
Web fares not found on MSE remain under 1%, though they ticked up slightly this week.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Below 1% share of itineraries, with a small increase from the previous week.
Up from 50% last month to nearly 65% this week, indicating growing price alignment.
Stable below 1%, showing negligible change from last week.
Declined from 49% last month to 34% this week, reducing the channel’s price advantage.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Mirrors the overall trend: same-price frequency climbing, while lower fares are dropping.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity jumped from 45% to 73%, while lower fares halved from 53% to 26% this week.
Same-price rates edged up slightly to 57%, while lower fares dipped from 45% to 42%.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Price matching rose by about 12% from last month, whereas lower fares fell from 46% to 34%.
Same fares reached 66%, up nearly 21% from last month, with lower fares down from 55% to 34%.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 95% of recently analyzed GDS fares are higher than the website, reflecting consistent channel markups.
Only about 2–4% of itineraries show cheaper GDS fares, highlighting rare pricing advantages.
Frequency and price differences remain stable across weeks and months, with under 1% change observed.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Under 0.5% of cases have no comparable GDS fare, indicating nearly full channel coverage.
Matched fares are uncommon, suggesting very limited parity with the website.
Fares consistently exceed the website’s prices, with steady rates over recent intervals.
A small slice of GDS bookings undercut the airline’s site, stable without clear growth.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Short-haul fares run about 97% higher in GDS, with shifts under 1% across the past weeks.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Over 98% of itineraries are priced above the site, leaving under 1% GDS-lower instances.
Around 95% carry a GDS premium, while up to 4% are lower, offering a small discount window.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS remains higher ~96–97% of the time, unchanged from prior weeks and months.
Over 97% of long-lead itineraries are priced above the airline’s site, with few matched or lower fares.
